image.altText: The Mayor Matt Paterson, wearing a white shirt sits at a table with a bell in the forefront.

props.synopsis: Matt Paterson campaigned as a "boring" mayor, but his term in a troubled part of Australia has been anything but dull — from wearing budgie smugglers at the airport, to regularly fronting national news and even calling for the sacking of the entire NT government.

title.children: 'There's no rule book': Alice Springs mayor to step down after eventful term

image.altText: A man and a woman inside a camper van.

props.synopsis: Northern Territory police have announced a new $500,000 reward for information that leads to the discovery of Peter Falconio's body, more than 20 years after his murder.

title.children: Police offer $500k reward in bid to find Peter Falconio's remains

image.altText: A full street with people marching with flags and signs, one says: liberation freedom restitution.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has been urged to convene national cabinet to address First Nations deaths in custody and incarceration, as justice leaders, experts and community voices meet today in Alice Springs.

title.children: First Nations leaders urge PM to convene national cabinet on prison crisis

props.synopsis: Organisers of an event to promote women's safety are disappointed and shocked after several women reported inappropriate behaviour while participating in the Take Back the Track run on Wednesday night.

title.children: Women assaulted on safety fun run in Alice Springs

image.altText: Illustrative map of Israel and Iran

props.synopsis: The geopolitical conditions for the Israel-Iran war have been brewing for decades, and the past 20 months have seen a titanic power shift.

title.children: Israel's approach to Iran has its origins in letter bombs sent to German scientists

image.altText: A man sitting on a couch.

props.synopsis: A former Iranian official says it will take the nation's nuclear experts mere months to rebuild what the US claims to have destroyed when it comes to nuclear technology.

title.children: Nuclear 'threat' issued by former Iranian official

image.altText: Clothes hanging on washing lines strung between palm trees above sand.

props.synopsis: The Pacific Island nation has rushed to apply to live in Australia under a landmark climate change visa.

title.children: In four days, nearly a third of Tuvalu applied to live in Australia

image.altText: Jim Chalmers responds to ABC Leaders Debate, federal election 20

props.synopsis: The treasurer has lowered expectations about achieving specific outcomes at his tax summit but he'll be looking for broad support in one direction.

title.children: Jim Chalmers is aiming for tax reform. Ken Henry has some ideas

image.altText: Peter Wellman James on a beach.

props.synopsis: Darwin drug baron Peter Wellman James, who's now in prison for supplying drugs, was running a fleet of ATMs despite a prior 2012 conviction.

title.children: Darwin's biggest drug dealer owned network of private ATMs

image.altText: Josh Inglis shoulders arms and is bowled

props.synopsis: Australia leads the West Indies by 82 runs with six wickets remaining after a controversial day two of the first Test in Barbados.

title.children: More DRS drama as Aussies ride their luck against fired up WIndies

image.altText: An elderly woman standing in front of the beach, crying.

props.synopsis: Even though she owns a cottage in the caravan park, 82-year-old Kathleen Philp has been given an eviction notice by management. And she is not alone.

title.children: 'Directed to leave immediately': Caravan park resident evicted from cottage

image.altText: A man with a beard, wearing a suit, stands before a wall with sponsors including Mercedes Benz.

props.synopsis: A Sydney financial consultant will live with his parents for a year while awaiting his trial over a number of charges, including sexual assault and dishonoured cheques.

title.children: Twelve women allege Sydney man fraudulently induced them into sex

image.altText: A red brick school building with manicured lawns and gardens.

props.synopsis: The ABC has spoken to a dozen families who say their sons have been subjected to, or groomed to inflict, violent punishments in an alleged decades-old cycle of torment at the Victorian boarding school.

title.children: Parents hire lawyers over alleged abuse at prestigious Ballarat Grammar

image.altText: Injection of vaccine being prepared

props.synopsis: Australia's vaccination rates against COVID and influenza are below ideal figures, but could a future innovation be able to change that?

title.children: COVID and flu vaccination rates are lagging. Would a combined dose fix that?

image.altText: A man with a missing hand, sitting in a wheelchair in his home.

props.synopsis: A spate of fishermen presenting to a small regional Queensland hospital in agony with gaping wounds sparked an investigation into the spread of a deadly infection.

title.children: Study finds climate change is driving spread of flesh-eating bacteria

image.altText: A dark skinned man wearing black sunglasses with pursed lips

props.synopsis: Prosecutors allege Sean "Diddy" Combs and his inner circle "committed hundreds of racketeering acts" in the closing arguments of his sex trafficking trial. His defence argued he was involved in domestic violence but not in racketeering.

title.children: Sean 'Diddy' Combs sex-trafficking trial hears closing arguments

image.altText: A banner hanging on a bridge in Venice that says no space for Bezos

props.synopsis: From Donald Trump's shock profanity to Jeff Bezos moving his wedding due to angry protesters, it has been another big week in news. Test yourself on what you remember.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Trump's shock profanity, hungry bears and a billionaire's wedding woes

image.altText: Ilotopie performers coated head to toe in pink photorapher from behind, feat their naked bottoms painted pink

props.synopsis: Thirty years after they were thrown into an Adelaide prison for public nudity, legendary French street artists Ilotopie returned to the scene of the crime — as nude, and as proud, as ever.

title.children: These artists came to Australia to wow us. Their show landed them in jail

image.altText: A hand holding up a phone displaying various uses of AI chatbot ChatGPT against a leafy backdrop

props.synopsis: Whether it's increasing productivity at school and work or creating concerns for people's job security, our readers share the ways generative AI is impacting their lives.

title.children: How generative AI is impacting our readers' everyday lives

image.altText: Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri pose for a photograph, Piastri (right) with his fist clinched

props.synopsis: Australian Oscar Piastri survived a crash with his teammate in Montreal to reaffirm his position atop the Formula 1 drivers' championship.

title.children: F1's three-way title fight resumes after McLaren's Canadian crash

image.altText: A man in a black suit stands on a beach with a woman in white dress standing to his left and a group of men in suits behind her

props.synopsis: Kim Jong Un has made tourism a top policy priority but the opening of the country's biggest tourist zone is yet to be followed by a return to international tourism.

title.children: North Korea has opened a new tourist zone. The only thing missing — foreign tourists

image.altText: Two people with rainbow umbrellas stand outside a building with a 'Planned Parenthood' sign above the door.

props.synopsis: A new ruling, supported by six of the Supreme Court's nine judges, will also allow states to cut off reimbursements to Planned Parenthood for many low-income Americans.

title.children: US Supreme Court gives states right to defund largest abortion provider

image.altText: Trum, with a raised fist, and Netanyahu smiles

props.synopsis: The US president says the US would save Israeli prime minister from his corruption trial, like it did his country.

title.children: Trump calls for Netanyahu's corruption trial to be cancelled

image.altText: A woman with long black hair smiles slightly while looking at something just past the camera

props.synopsis: Truong My Lan had her appeal against the death penalty dismissed last year as she scrambled to repay billions of dollars, but law changes in Vietnam might have saved her life.

title.children: Mastermind of $41b fraud likely spared death sentence in Vietnam

image.altText: A dog sits in a small room with wallpaper and a dog bed.

props.synopsis: Luxury pet hotels, wedding chaperones and doggy outings. Are we spending more than ever on our pets?

title.children: Keeping our pets happy and healthy is big business

image.altText: A dimly lit pokies room with bright colourful lights coming from each of the machines.

props.synopsis: The social cost of gambling in Victoria, such as bankruptcy, loss of productivity at work, mental ill-health, and divorce, has reached $14 billion, a new study has found.

title.children: Cost of gambling harm in Victoria reaches $14 billion, with pokies behind most losses

image.altText: Close up of a Fuji apple with a barcode sticker

props.synopsis: A South Australian plan to ban non-compostable labels on fresh produce has come unstuck with growers worried about higher costs for consumers during tough times.

title.children: Stuck for a suitable alternative, SA puts fruit sticker ban on hold

image.altText: A woman with a 7 News microphone in front of her face.

props.synopsis: The judge in Erin Patterson's triple-murder trial has told jurors they will not begin deliberations until next week.

title.children: Erin Patterson jury deliberations to begin next week, judge tells court

image.altText: Michelle Turbey looks to the right of frame.

props.synopsis: Almost three years after he was killed, the two men who murdered 15-year-old Perth schoolboy Cassius Turvey are set to be sentenced.

title.children: 'Racially vilified': Schoolboy's mother speaks out ahead of killers' sentence

image.altText: A family looks out onto planes on the tarmac at an airport.

props.synopsis: In the days after the Air India crash, it was revealed that warnings had been issued about some of the airline's other planes. So, why isn't information like this always publicly available? And how can we know which airlines are safe?

title.children: Why getting info about airline safety records is harder than you think

image.altText: Ley walks through crowd, Anne Ruston walks behind her.

props.synopsis: This week in politics Sussan Ley fronts the National Press Club, job cuts are coming for Parliament House and questions remain unanswered about US military operations on Australian shores.

title.children: Ley treads where Dutton didn't dare, Albanese grounds Airbus Albo

image.altText: A middle-aged wearing a suit smiles

props.synopsis: Canadian filmmaker Denis Villeneuve is set to direct the next James Bond movie, Amazon MGM Studios announces.

title.children: Oscar-nominated filmmaker Denis Villeneuve to direct next James Bond film

image.altText: aerial image of police car at scene of alleged assault in wheatsheaf

props.synopsis: A former Australian Army reservist who murdered his neighbour by throwing petrol on him and lighting him on fire will be in his 90s by the time he is eligible for parole.

title.children: 'Sad, angry' man jailed for 35 years after lighting neighbour on fire

image.altText: man in suit smiling next to man in sports jacket with grey hair in golf buggy

props.synopsis: Laws that allow the South Australian government to redevelop the North Adelaide Golf Course and move the LIV Golf tournament into the city pass parliament.

title.children: Golf redevelopment to go ahead after controversial laws pass SA parliament

image.altText: Miley Cyrus stands for a photo wearing a black, silver and purple dress with houses and trees below her in the background.

props.synopsis: Unable to tour for health reasons, Miley Cyrus has made a visual album she has described as similar to Pink Floyd's The Wall, but "with a better wardrobe".

title.children: Miley Cyrus can't tour anymore, so she made a one-night cinema spectacular
